Ad Text:
About Us 

At CleanCo we are delivering clean energy solutions to help our customers thrive in a net zero future.

We own and operate more than 1GW of low emission energy generation and we are actively growing our portfolio to help propel Queensland’s energy transformation.

We are a passionate, inclusive team committed to creating a clean energy future for Queensland. If our mission resonates with you, consider a career with CleanCo.

About the Opportunity

As our SAP Reporting Specialist, you’ll play a key role in helping CleanCo make confident, data-driven decisions. Working with SAP RISE and SAP Analytics Cloud, you’ll shape the reporting and insights that our teams rely on every day.

You’ll build and refine reporting frameworks, ensure our data is accurate and trusted, and work closely with colleagues and partners to keep our systems connected, compliant, and easy to use. This role is all about turning complex information into clear insights that support CleanCo’s strategy and the communities we serve.

About you 

You bring proven experience with SAP ERP systems, particularly SAP Cloud Analytics Services and Business Warehouse, and ideally exposure to SAP RISE. You have strong analytical skills, a solid understanding of data governance, and experience delivering data analytics projects for cross-functional teams.

Your background includes:

Extensive experience with in BW/HANA and Embedded BPC (FOX code)

Experience with CDS Views, S/4HANA, and SAC with live data connections

Ability to manage competing priorities and build strong relationships at all levels

Tertiary qualifications in IT, Data Science, or related fields (desirable)

SAP Analytics Cloud certification preferred

We encourage applications from neurodivergent people, people with disability, First Nations people, and those from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds. Adjustments to the recruitment process are available on request.

What We Can Offer

We understand that work is just one important aspect of our employee’s lives. We offer a range of benefits that support balance and create an engaging workplace, by meeting you at your life and career stage. Perks and benefits of joining the CleanCo team include:

• Genuine flex work options – supported hybrid working model

• A progressive and inclusive culture that reflects our unique identity

• Opportunities to purchase additional leave

• Discounted health insurance, Fitness Passport, and health promotion programs

• Opportunities to save via Salary Sacrificing which may increase your take home pay

• Wellbeing support via our Employee Assistance Program and Mates in Energy membership




CleanCo is a proud 2025 Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to responding to every applicant. 

For more information about CleanCo please visit https://www.cleancoqueensland.com.au.

About Beon Energy Solutions:

Beon is a company of dedicated professionals committed to future-focused energy solutions with a heritage in safety and reliability. We bring technical expertise and agility to provide energy solutions from every angle for; renewable energy, utility and infrastructure, commercial and industrial projects across Australia.

We deploy large-scale renewable energy and infrastructure projects, with expertise in design, construction and maintenance. Our clients include some of Australia’s largest electricity utilities, infrastructure and renewable developers, commercial and industrial companies and transport network operators.

About the Role:

We are looking for an experienced Systems Data Analyst to join our Project Controls team based at our Melbourne’s CBD head office on a full time and permanent basis. 

The Systems Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, validating, analysing and reporting quality-related and construction progress data across the full project lifecycle. The role will ensure the integrity, traceability and consistency of data within digital quality and construction reporting platforms, supporting project teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.

The insights provided by this role will directly influence quality performance, construction productivity, risk management, client reporting and continuous improvement across Beon’s portfolio of solar, BESS and infrastructure projects. You will also contribute to the standardisation and optimisation of digital tools, dashboards and reporting processes across the business.

What you’ll deliver:

Maintain accuracy, completeness and consistency of quality and construction data within platforms such as TrueContext/ProntoForms, Procore and other QMS tools

Establish new projects within digital systems, including structures, registers, templates and user permissions aligned to the Quality Management Plan

Conduct regular data validation, reconciliation and housekeeping activities to identify gaps or discrepancies and support corrective actions

Enhance digital forms, templates and workflows to meet project and client requirements

Provide evidence-based recommendations to improve QA/QC processes, inspection planning, defect close-out and construction sequencing

Extract and analyse quality and construction performance data to produce dashboards, progress reports and visualisations

Perform integrity checks and calculations to support key quality and construction KPIs used by Project Managers, Quality Leads and senior stakeholders

Assist with compiling audit evidence, handover documentation and client submissions, ensuring alignment with QMS and contractual requirements

Collaborate with project teams, site personnel and subcontractors to improve data capture and the timely completion of digital records

Provide training, support and guidance to promote consistent use of digital quality and construction reporting tools

To succeed in this role you’ll have:

Bachelor of Engineering, Information Technology, Mathematics or a related technical/commercial degree

Strong foundation in data analysis methods and techniques

Ability to interpret complex quality and construction data, identify root causes and deliver clear insights

Proficiency in Excel (advanced), SQL and/or Python is highly desirable

Understanding of the Australian energy sector (preferred).

Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving and continuous improvement mindset.

Demonstrated experience working with data management and analysis in engineering, construction, quality or similar environments

Proven stakeholder management skills and the ability to engage cross-functional teams to drive data accuracy

Strong written and verbal communication, with high attention to detail.

Your career with Beon Energy Solutions:

We have a diversity of teams across our business, all contributing to great customer and community outcomes. Our people are our most important asset, and we continually invest in nurturing their capability.

We proudly strive to provide a safe, inclusive and sustainable environment where all our people feel respected, valued and supported to bring their whole selves to work and be the best they can be.

With an embedded Inclusion & Diversity Strategy and initiatives like our Women in Power networking group, and Sparkle, our LGBTIQ+ allies pride network, we’re committed to equal opportunities for all employees. 

We are proud to be recognised as a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for all women. Click here to check out our benefits.   https://work180.com/en-au/for-women/employer/powercor/benefits

Our greatest priority is the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and the communities we operate within. This includes their physical safety – ensuring everyone gets home safely everyday – as well as their psychological safety, by ensuring everyone has the resources and support needed to achieve a work-life balance and be the best they can be.   

What’s next?

Please submit your application via our careers website by 22 December 2025. For the full Position Description, reach out to Tom from the Talent Team at Careers@Powercor.com.au

Candidates will be reviewed and contacted in early Jan 2026.

We encourage applications from all communities; people of all ages, nationalities, abilities and cultures, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability.

If you require adjustments as part of the recruitment process to accommodate your needs, please don’t hesitate to discuss these with us.
